page.title: 18Local politics
page.content: Indian Queens belongs to the North Cornwall Parliamentary constituency and the M.P.since 1983 has been the Conservative Gerry Neale.He had a big majority of over 10,000 votes. For many centuries the district known as Indian Queens was part of the South Quarter,or Ward,of the parish of St.Columb Major.Since 1894 elected members from the area have been members of St.Columb Parish Council.On April 1st.1983 Indian Queens and St.Columb Road joined Fraddon as part of the adjacent parish of St.Enoder. One of the elected Councillors on St. Enoder Parish Council is Mr.Maurice Hawkins who was Headmaster of the Indian Queens School from just after the Second World War until his retirement in 1976.
